definition: to lie down/to drop to the ground
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: She saved the children's lives by fling them to the floor.
sentences.chinese: 她让孩子们迅速卧倒，这样救了他们的生命。

sentences.english: I was in my room, lying down, when I heard loud explosions.
sentences.chinese: 听到大爆炸到时候，我在自己的房间里卧倒。

sentences.english: Down I went, sprawled on all fours.
Specifies frames used when an infantry is prone and returning fire.
sentences.chinese: 指定当步兵卧倒开仗的帧序列。

sentences.english: When a pandaren drops down to all fours, his speed increases greatly.
sentences.chinese: 当一个熊猫人卧倒至四肢，他的速度极大提升。

sentences.english: The private in front of him began crawling.
sentences.chinese: 在他前面的士兵开始卧倒，匍匐前进。

sentences.english: If the enemy opened fire, keep down.
The soldiers flung themselves down when they heard the bombs falling.
sentences.chinese: 士兵们听到炸弹呼啸降落时，就迅速卧倒。

sentences.english: General Barton said if there was any hurry to hurl down on the ground.
sentences.chinese: 巴顿将军问是否有必要马上要卧倒在地面上。

sentences.english: Everyone should lie face down when the enemy planes come over.
sentences.chinese: 敌机来时，每人都要面朝地卧倒。

definition: to open fire/to shoot a gun
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to put one's hands behind one's head, fingers interlaced/to hold one's head in one's hands (in dismay, fright etc)/to cover one's head with one's hands (for protection)
to fall headlong/(fig.) to suffer an ignominious failure
